_header: Alas to whom should I complain b
Note:
First stanza occurs separately, as lover’s complaint, 300; Cf. 3869; Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 109.
_description: A farewell by Edward Stafford, Third Duke of Buckingham, executed in A.D. 1521 — twenty-two quatrains, each ending with ‘remedyles’

BLHar2252.First Lines:
Alas to whom shuld I complayne or shewe my woful hevynesSythe
                    fortune hathe me in dysdayne & am exiled Remedyles…
BLHar2252.Last Lines:
…Ihesu reward them bothe bodely & goostlye fro all aduersyte
                    & grete dystresseÞat wyll pray for the sowle of the Dwke of
                    Bokyngam þat late was exiled remedyles
